bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 2, 1929

div1.p: Ireland sends Emilie Lawrence Reed a map of the Fort Robinson Station, near a butte which has been named for Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 2, 1929

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
December 2, 1929.

div1.p:
In October, before you returned to
the city, the Commanding Officer of Field
Artillery at Fort Robinson sent me the
inclosed map of that station in which one
of the Buttes is named for Captain Walter
Reed, who was stationed there in the
early days. I acknowledged the receipt
of the letter and told him I would send
this map to you when you returned to the
city.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, M W Ireland Mrs. Walter Reed,
The Burlington,
Washington.
